column1: Data Supplied By: National Livestock Reporting Service
Data source: National Livestock Reporting Service
Please see terms of use here: https://www.mla.com.au/general/Terms-and-conditions/data-and-information/

With scattered showers in the supply area Blackall Agents had a reduced yarding to 961 head. All the regular processors present as well as feedlotters and backgrounders. A mixed quality yarding of cattle penned.

Light weight yearling steers under 200kg topped 318c/kg. Medium weight yearling steers  sold from 292c to 334c/kg. 

Light weight yearling heifers under 200kg topped 258c to average 237c/kg. Yearling heifers 200 to 280kg with the majority selling from 246c to 290c/kg for the better quality lines. Yearling heifers 280 to 330kg sold to a firm market and sold to 275c/kg. Yearling heifers 400 to 480kg to feed made from 216c to 235c/kg.

Grown steers over 600kg topped 296c/kg. Grown heifers over 540kg sold well to 276c/kg. A small number of cows penned and sold to a stronger trend. The 2 score cows sold from 200c to 235c/kg. The 3 score cows made to 286c to average 269c/kg. A large number of bulls also penned. Bulls over 600kg made from 150c to a top of 232c/kg. Bulls under 450kg made to 294c/kg. A quality line Santa cross cow & calves sold to $1740/head

Market Reporter David Friend.
